intro: Ichnanthus petiolatus var. lanceolatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf marsh herb, is a flowering plant native to wetland environments in North America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, often found in marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and it blooms in early summer. The species is valued for its ecological role in supporting aquatic and semi-aquatic wildlife.
